r:Title.r:String: OpenMuSE T1.3 Hospitality Survey Distributed Through A Survey Panel Provider full

r:AlternateTitle.r:String: OpenMusE Hospitality Survey Distributed Through A Survey Panel Provider

r:Copyright.r:String: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0 Sant’Anna School of Advanced Studies (SSSA)

r:Citation.description: Survey of professionals working in hospitality venues in Germany, Italy, and Poland on the use and economic value of music within the hospitality sector. The survey was conducted via online self-completion among professionals employed in hospitality venues (e.g., restaurants, bars, cafés, hotels) who are part of the survey panel provider. All respondents work in the Food/Beverage/Restaurant or Travel/Tourism/Hospitality industries, use background music in their workplace, and have relevant job experience (Owner/Partner, Senior Management, Middle Management, Front Line Management, Experienced Professional, or Home-Based Business Owner). Employment types include full-time, part-time, self-employed, or contract/freelance/temporary. Only completed interviews were included in the final sample (N=601; Germany=230, Italy=150, Poland=221). The survey covers topics such as employment and workplace characteristics, business size and type, presence and management of background music, music selection and licensing, integration of music into the customer experience, organization and frequency of live music events, and the perceived economic impact of music on venue performance.
r:Citation.subject: Music

r:Abstract.r:Content: Survey of professionals working in hospitality venues in Germany, Italy, and Poland on the use and economic value of music within the hospitality sector. The survey was conducted via online self-completion among professionals employed in hospitality venues (e.g., restaurants, bars, cafés, hotels) who are part of the survey panel provider. All respondents work in the Food/Beverage/Restaurant or Travel/Tourism/Hospitality industries, use background music in their workplace, and have relevant job experience (Owner/Partner, Senior Management, Middle Management, Front Line Management, Experienced Professional, or Home-Based Business Owner). Employment types include full-time, part-time, self-employed, or contract/freelance/temporary. Only completed interviews were included in the final sample (N=601; Germany=230, Italy=150, Poland=221). The survey covers topics such as employment and workplace characteristics, business size and type, presence and management of background music, music selection and licensing, integration of music into the customer experience, organization and frequency of live music events, and the perceived economic impact of music on venue performance. Data collection start date 05.08.2025. Data collection end date 11.09.2025.

r:Purpose.r:Content: T1.3. The survey data collection (lead: SSSA; contributors: SOZA, ARTISJUS, MUSICAUTOR, EUBA). [Start: M17, End: M32]. The first concerns what is potentially underrepresented in official statistics, calling for the development and distribution of surveys targeting both professionals and MSMEs, while also testing different sampling and distribution methodologies. The second is methodological: to assess the extent to which firm-level commercial databases can support survey implementation, particularly for MSMEs.

r:Label.r:Content: Professionals working in hospitality venues (e.g., restaurants, bars, cafés, hotels) of DE, IT, PL

r:Description.r:Content: Professionals working in hospitality venues (e.g., restaurants, bars, cafés, hotels) of DE, IT, PL. Quota sample sourced from an online survey panel.
Data collections that employ both interviewing and sampling to produce quantitative data-sets, amenable to computer-based analysis.
